issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description: Pass down the remote ip address down to authorizer. Underlying authorizer implementation can make use of this information for its own authorization rule.
fields.summary: Pass remote ip address down to YarnAuthorizationProvider

This message was automatically generated.

Is {{AccessRequest.java}} supposed to be a public class (it's in {{org.apache.hadoop.yarn.security}})? If so, then the constructor changes you made have compatibility implications. If it isn't public, we should move it out of yarn-common. If it is, we should set the right visibility & audience annotations.

The AccessRequest.java is added in 2.9, I think it should be fine.  I added public/unstable annotations to the class.

uploading a new patch, fixed the javac warnings.
